meanings.definition: The act or process of magnifying.
meanings.sent1: The magnification of the tiny insect made it look huge.
meanings.sent2: The magnification of the image on the screen helped us see the details clearly.
meanings.sent3: With the magnification of his storytelling, the fish he caught grew bigger with each retelling.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like a magnification lens, making everyone around her more excited.
meanings.sent5: The magnification of the mountain in the distance made it seem like it was right in front of us.

meanings.sent1: The magnification of the painting's colors brought it to life.
meanings.sent2: The magnification of his achievements made him a role model for many.
meanings.sent3: The magnification of the cat's purring made it sound like a lion's roar.
meanings.sent4: The magnification of her kindness was evident in every small gesture she made.
meanings.sent5: The magnification of the star's brightness made it shine like a diamond in the sky.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is magnified.
meanings.sent1: The magnification of the microscope allowed us to see the cells clearly.
meanings.sent2: The magnification of the map helped us pinpoint our location accurately.
meanings.sent3: The magnification of his excitement about the party made us all eager to join.
meanings.sent4: The magnification of her voice through the microphone filled the entire hall.
meanings.sent5: The magnification of the flower's beauty through the lens made it appear even more stunning.
